article.headline: Niagara 97, Iona 91
article.story: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y. (AP) -- Juan Mendez scored 25 points, including the go-ahead free throws with 1:08 left, and Niagara beat Iona 97-91 on Sunday, snapping the Purple Eagles' 15-game losing streak at the Mulcahy Center. The win was the Purple Eagles' first on the road over Iona since Niagara joined the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference in 1989. After Mendez's free throws gave Niagara (13-6, 7-3) a 92-91 lead, he blocked Greg Jenkins' dunk attempt. Niagara's Alvin Cruz was then fouled and made one free throw with 37 seconds left. Jenkins was fouled 2 seconds later, but missed both free throws. Anthony Bruin of the Gaels (7-13, 5-6) was fouled with 17 seconds left and also missed two free throws. Niagara then clinched the victory on two free throws each by Tremmell Darden and Lorenzo Miles. The Purple Eagles were 33-for-41 from the free throw line, while Iona went 13-for-26. Darden finished with 24 points for the Purple Eagles, while David Brooks had 20. Cruz finished with 15 points and seven assists. DeShaun Williams scored 27 points for Iona, which led 80-73 with 7:44 remaining, while Steve Burtt and Kiril Wachsmann each had 14.
